dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, I was reading this Forbes article, uh, about capital investment, and it really highlights how these massive tech companies are actually, like, huge economic drivers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, I was reading this Forbes article, uh, about capital investment, and it really highlights how these massive tech companies are actually, like, huge economic drivers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation, boosts production and distribution capacity and combats inflation by shoring up supply, the reports authors argue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure! I saw that too. Especially Amazon, right? Their investment last year was just wild, apparently, helping spur job creation and all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure! I saw that too. Especially Amazon, right? Their investment last year was just wild, apparently, helping spur job creation and all that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation... In Amazons case, the extra investment on property and equipment last year was driven by the need to meet an enormous surge of demand during the pandemic... BIG NUMBER 500,000. Thats how many workers Amazon added in 2020, according to the report.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally! The report argues these investments, uh, boost production and distribution, and even help fight inflation by shoring up supply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally! The report argues these investments, uh, boost production and distribution, and even help fight inflation by shoring up supply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation, boosts production and distribution capacity and combats inflation by shoring up supply, the reports authors argue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge, especially coming out of the pandemic. I mean, Amazon was number ten on PPI's 'Investment Heroes' list for a reason.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge, especially coming out of the pandemic. I mean, Amazon was number ten on P P I's Investment Heroes list for a reason.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those investments put the firm in PPIs top slot on its list of Investment Heroes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's not just them. Verizon, AT&T, Microsoft, Intel... we're talking, uh, billions of dollars each in domestic capital investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's not just them. Verizon, A T and T, Microsoft, Intel... we're talking, uh, billions of dollars each in domestic capital investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Verizon was second on PPIs list with $16.1 billion in domestic capital investment last year, AT&T was third on the list with $15.6 billion invested, and Alphabet and Intel rounded out the top five with $14 billion and $12.5 billion invested, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Billions! It's kind of staggering when you think about it. The report even said their willingness to keep spending essentially made it possible for large chunks of the economy to move forward, despite the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Billions! It's kind of staggering when you think about it. The report even said their willingness to keep spending essentially made it possible for large chunks of the economy to move forward, despite the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The willingness of these companies to keep spending essentially made it possible for large chunks of the economy to move forward, despite the pandemic, the report states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, um, a pretty powerful statement. But, you know, with Amazon, it's rarely just one narrative, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, um, a pretty powerful statement. But, you know, with Amazon, it's rarely just one narrative, is it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, absolutely not. The criticism is, like, equally as strong. Think about the DC Attorney General suing them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely not. The criticism is, like, equally as strong. Think about the D C Attorney General suing them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm was recently sued by the attorney general of the District of Columbia over allegations that it engaged in anticompetitive practices that have raised prices for consumers and stifled innovation and choice across the entire online retail market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, over allegations of anticompetitive practices, raising prices for consumers, stifling innovation and choice across the whole online market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, over allegations of anticompetitive practices, raising prices for consumers, stifling innovation and choice across the whole online market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm was recently sued by the attorney general of the District of Columbia over allegations that it engaged in anticompetitive practices that have raised prices for consumers and stifled innovation and choice across the entire online retail market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's the MGM purchase, which Rep. David Cicilline was, uh, pretty vocal about. He sees that as them just laser-focused on expanding their monopoly power.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's the M G M purchase, which Rep. David Cicilline was, uh, pretty vocal about. He sees that as them just laser-focused on expanding their monopoly power.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rep. David Cicilline (D-R.I.) said Amazons recent purchase of film studio MGM is a sign that the company is laser-focused on expanding and entrenching their monopoly power.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really makes you think about the balance, doesn't it? Like, on one hand, these massive investments are happening, driving the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really makes you think about the balance, doesn't it? Like, on one hand, these massive investments are happening, driving the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But on the other, you've got these serious concerns about their business practices, [overlap] even worker safety during the pandemic was a huge issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But on the other, you've got these serious concerns about their business practices, even worker safety during the pandemic was a huge issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And thats not to mention criticism over the way the company handled safety protocols for workers and drivers during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Exactly! It's a really complex picture these, uh, tech giants present.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's a really complex picture these, uh, tech giants present.

dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's never simple with these companies.
